item.title: Problem Nth Tribonacci Number
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1137 Question The Tribonacci sequence T(n) is defined as follows: T(0) = 0, T(1) = 1, T(2) = 1, and T(n+3) = T(n) + T(n+1) + T(n+2) for n >= 0. Given n, return the value of T(n). Note to self This is a straight forward Recursion Problem. We can convert this to DP by using memoization. We will use an array to store the intermediate values to prevent repeated calculations.
